metadata.title: CVE-2016-8616 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in curl before version 7.51.0 When re-using a connection,curl was doing case insensitive comparisons of user name and password withthe existing connections. This means that if an unused connection withproper credentials exists for a protocol that has connection-scopedcredentials, an attacker can cause that connection to be reused if s/heknows the case-insensitive version of the correct password.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8616` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3 - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
libcurl3-nss - 7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.47.0-1ubuntu2.2').
